010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013
014import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
015
016/**
017 * This class implements a D65-based sRGBcolor space without performing
018 * chromatic adaptation between D50 and D65, as required by Java's profile 
019 * connection space. Everything is D65, components of all {@code float[]} colors
020 * are supposed to be in [0,1].
021 * This is a singleton class with no public constructors,
022 * use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
023 * 
024 */
025@SuppressWarnings("serial")
026public class sRgb65ColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
027        
028        private static final sRgb65ColorSpace instance = new sRgb65ColorSpace();
029        
030        public static sRgb65ColorSpace getInstance() {
031                return instance;
032        }
033        
034        /** Matrix for conversion from linear RGB to XYZ. */
035        public static final double[][] Mrgb =    // (R,G,B) = Mrgb * (X,Y,Z)   // Poynton (ITU 709) 
036                {{3.240479, -1.537150, -0.498535},
037                 {-0.969256, 1.875992, 0.041556},
038                 {0.055648, -0.204043, 1.057311}};
039        
040        /** Matrix for conversion from XYZ to linear RGB (inverse of {@link #Mrgb}). 
041         * The actual inverse is calculated here for better accuracy. 
042         */
043        public static final double[][] Mrgbi = Matrix.inverse(Mrgb);
044        
045//      public static final double[][] Mrgbi =    // (X,Y,Z) = Mrgbi * (R,G,B)   // Poynton (ITU 709) 
046//              {{0.412453, 0.357580, 0.180423},
047//               {0.212671, 0.715160, 0.072169},
048//               {0.019334, 0.119193, 0.950227}};
049
050        /**
051         * Constructor.
052         */
053        private sRgb65ColorSpace() {
054                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
055        }
056
057        // XYZ (D65) -> sRGB conversion
058        @Override
059        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz) {
060                double[] rgb = Matrix.multiply(Mrgb, Matrix.toDouble(xyz));             
061                float[] srgb = new float[3];
062                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
063                        srgb[i] = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(rgb[i]);
064                }
065                return srgb;
066        }
067        
068        @Override
069        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
070                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
071//              return srgb;
072        }
073
074        // sRGB -> XYZ (D65) conversion
075        @Override
076        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] srgb) {
077                // get linear rgb components:
078                double[] rgb = new double[3];
079                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
080                        rgb[i] = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[i]);
081                }
082                // convert to XYZ (Poynton / ITU 709) 
083                double[] xyz = Matrix.multiply(Mrgbi, rgb);
084                return Matrix.toFloat(xyz);
085        }
086
087        @Override
088        public float[] toRGB(float[] srgb) {
089                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
090//              return srgb;
091        }
092
093}
